concise_definition: v. 开花, 繁荣; n. 花, 花朵, 蓬勃期

definitions.explanation_en: To produce flowers; to reach the stage in a plant's life cycle when flowers appear and are fully open.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指植物进入生命周期中开花的阶段，花朵完全绽放。
definitions.example_en: The cherry trees bloom every spring, painting the landscape in soft pink.
definitions.example_cn: 每年春天，樱花树都会盛开，将大地染成柔和的粉红色。

definitions.explanation_en: To flourish or thrive, especially during a period of peak activity, creativity, or success.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指（人或事物）在某个时期达到鼎盛、繁荣或充满活力的状态，常用于形容才华、事业或文化的高峰期。
definitions.example_en: She really bloomed after she moved to the city and found her artistic voice.
definitions.example_cn: 她搬到城市并找到自己的艺术声音后，才华得到了充分展现。

definitions.explanation_en: A flower or a group of flowers, especially when they are fresh, colorful, and in full display.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一朵花或一簇花，尤指新鲜、色彩鲜艳且完全绽放的花朵。
definitions.example_en: The garden was filled with the vibrant bloom of tulips and daffodils.
definitions.example_cn: 花园里盛开着郁金香和水仙花，色彩绚丽。

definitions.explanation_en: A period of peak development, growth, or prosperity; the time when something is at its best or most active.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某事物发展、成长或繁荣的鼎盛时期，即其最活跃或最出色的状态。
definitions.example_en: The 1920s were the bloom of jazz music in America.
definitions.example_cn: 20世纪20年代是爵士乐在美国的黄金时期。

comparison.analysis: “Flower” (花) 是一个名词，指植物的生殖器官，强调具体的植物结构。而 “bloom” 既可以作名词也可以作动词，作为名词时更强调花朵盛开的状态或整体视觉效果，作为动词时则强调开花这一动态过程。
“Thrive” (茁壮成长) 指在良好条件下持续发展、繁荣，常用于描述生物、经济或组织的健康状态，语义更广泛且偏重持续性。而 “bloom” 作为动词时，更强调达到一个短暂而耀眼的巅峰状态，常带有诗意或象征性。
“Burst” (爆发) 强调突然、剧烈的释放或出现，如“burst into bloom”表示突然盛开，带有强烈冲击感。而 “bloom” 本身是渐进、自然、优雅的绽放过程，不强调突然性，更注重美感和周期性。
